comment: Tests are easy, quizzes are open note. The worst part about this class is that there's no partial credit, which made me gain a few grey hairs pulling off an A. He's nice over email though. I would take someone else online, or this guy only in person.

He is an ok professor, lectures are so boring and he will fail you if you miss more than 5 classes which is too extra for this class. Exams are much harder than quizzes and he words exam questions really weird to throw you off.

10 Quizzes, 4 tests including final, textbook was free. Gave out practice problems to do indepently, which were almost always identical to quiz questions. Test questions where similar, to quiz questions, but where not in practice problems, but if you understood how to do the practice problems you could easily figure out the test questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Tests were really hard and he doesn't allow any outside materials. Lectures are so boring. Quizzes are open notes.

Grades harder on homework than tests. You can find the book online for free. Allows one 8x11 sheet front and back cheat sheet for each test. Quizzes only have a 2 day window and aren't too difficult if you have the book and examples from class. If you study the material you will be fine. Lowest test grade was an 89. Got a 95 on the final.

He grades homework for correctness, and exams were tricky with unit conversions and unnecessary vocabulary, but he gave great partial credit. He used to have a final paper, but he decided to not give that anymore! He allows a "cheat sheet" for exams, and you can put anything on there. I had him for lab and he graded the first lab report harshly.
Dr. Seo is patient when you ask him questions. He is strict on grading papers, but you will give detailed feedbacks if you ask him. he is knowledgeable about concepts. Gey easy A in this class.

This professor was awesome. The test seemed hard, but he made huge extra curves on the final grade. Dr. Seo was really helpful when I had questions about testing/studying. Lots of assignments, but they're easy to do. I would take him for next time.

Dr. Seo is knowledgable and experienced in his field. His class is challenging without a doubt. Largely due to the difficulty and amount of material we were tested on. Some of this feedback is exaggeration- take the negativity with a grain of salt. He cares if you care to make an effort and does his best to prepare you for exams.

Does not reply to emails, especially ones where he has made errors in grading, which he does and it will effect your grade. Not approachable, condescending, and not very willing to help. If It is not written in his solution guide, he won't be able to solve it. Makes errors, so its difficult to learn how to do things correctly. overly harsh grader

This is a hard class, no matter who you take, but there is a certain point where already difficult material is complicated by a professor. He read basically from the book. He is an extremely tough grader, meaning that his free response questions, of which there are only 4 on a test, he gives little to no partial credit. Hard for no reason.

He didn't test for if we knew the concepts just if we could get the right answers which meant if you got the question correct but had the wrong sign you would get 1/15 points. His grading was abysmal and his teaching was terrible. You'll have to teach yourself if you want a chance to pass. Literally take any professor over this one. Save your GPA.

Absolutely avoid at all costs. Hes an okay lecturer, but his tests and quizzes set you up for failure. We had three tests and three quizzes. The first test he did not give partial credit. He only looked at the final answer. Second test same thing. Third test he pulled problems from the first test disregarding the syllabus. 1st quiz was 2Q multiple
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: If you take this professor get ready to spend lots of time outside of class teaching yourself! He does not give partial credit and expects perfection when he himself can not do problems right in class. I don't think he could solve a problem without looking in the book at the step by step instructions.

His name is Seo pronounced Saw and he will Saw your GPA in half if you take him. This man claims to give partial credit, but his definition of that is 0.5 points out of 15. He is completely unreasonable when it comes to grading. Avoid him at all costs!
Poor email communication. Takes off too much mark for theory questions in the exam. He wants summary/ papers to be very long. Not Recommended to take his class!!

I really just don't like him. He's a terrible lecturer. The stuff that he doesn't need to spend a lot of time on he spends way too much time on and vice versa. Just an all around boring lecturer at best. For our class, for exams, he wouldn't give a formula sheet. FE manual was no help either. Too bad he's the only one teaching this.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Only a few homework grades so make sure you do well on those. Exams are difficult, sometimes the problem types are not found in his lectures, the textbook, or anywhere for that matter. Do the review textbook problems in the back of the chapter; they will help on quizzes and some parts of the exams. ALSO, he takes off points for not having a % sign.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is a good teacher, you learn lots of material, and you learn it well. The problem is that the tests differ vastly from the lectures. The theory questions appeared from left field and the work out problems were different than previous examples, often with petty steps (such as mid problem U.S to metric, etc conversions) thrown in necessarily
He is an awesome professor that I have ever taken in KSU. Just take him if his class is available.

Dr. Seo really cares about the class and students. He teaches on the chalkboard as opposed to PowerPoints. This class can be done during the Summer Semester.  Graded Homework, Quizzes, and Exams. The homework problems are uploaded. Also the textbook is online if you know where to look

Dr. Seo is a awesome teacher, when he saw the class was having trouble getting the material, he changed his teaching method and it helped alot on quizzes and tests. He does what he can to help you pass the exams. If you put in some effort you will get a good grade in his class.

Dr. Seo is a decent professor. He doesn't always connect well with the class. Sometimes doesn't understand questions (foreign). Nice guy though. His tests are pretty difficult. It seems as though he picks the hard questions from the textbook. If he gives you practice problems, do them. You won't regret it. A little boring at times.
